title: Everything about this app is unnecessary
text:
- Why do i need to download a dedicated app to track my package? Why can‚Äôt i just pop the shipping number into the website to see the status of my package like literally any other shopping service? I have not even been given a shipping number
- Of course you can‚Äôt just log in with a password, or even enter a code it emails you, instead you have to open a separate mail app on the device to click a button on an email to log in. Silly me, my account email is a different one than i have logged in on my phone so i had to forward the email from my computer to my phone just to log into the app.
- Then of course the package isn‚Äôt automatically tracked on my account apparently, after being affronted with advertisements for other products i eventually found that i need to scan a QR code on an entirely different website to link the package tracking to my account.
- The actual information it gives me for the status of my package is nothing, just a blue progress bar with no further information. The fact that there‚Äôs a button to ‚Äòmark as delivered‚Äô worries me as I think this app is just as confused about the status of my package as i am. Was it lost or stolen? Has it even been shipped yet? It‚Äôs been over a month so i sure hope so.

I would say to avoid downloading this app at all costs but chances are given how many online retailers use this terrible service you probably won‚Äôt have a choice.

title: App Willing Hosts Scams
text: I bought a shirt on this app about 8 months ago. When the shirt was never delivered, I attempted to contact the seller, Jacob Markovitch, who did not respond. After a couple months, I attempted to report him to the app, when I discovered that the app does not enforce that the seller actually send you what you bought, and would not take a report unless it had to do with sexual content / child endangerment. Shopify is so mainstream I trusted that it would not willingly be a home to scammers, but here I am 8 months later with no shirt and no refund.

title: Geo
text: Great way of keeping track of your coins and grading them,the only downfall that might turn people away(just saying for myself) is how secret is your information? I understand the current administration has plans to tax people on thier collections that have been collecting probably all their life,without having the knowledge of rules that would have maybe changed what they collected. I don‚Äôt think the gov should have the right to tax you on coin collections(we paid sales tax when we bought them)and are say doll collections taxed? I‚Äôm nervous having a record of any coin collection on file with a website that might be forced to give tax info to the government.

title: The concept is great but...
text:
The Amazon source signs me out randomly. Happens every single day. I reconnect my account, all is fine, then a few hours later I'm signed out of Amazon. And there's no alert when this happens even though I have Notifications enabled. 

This problem has been going on for the last year it seems. Please fix it.

title: Useless and non-functioning
text:
Update: Still completely non-functioning app. 
I live in a city so packages get stolen, I really don‚Äôt want a notification that it‚Äôs here when it‚Äôs days away. Or that is was never delivered when I‚Äôve had it for days. My question is truly, why do companies launch apps that don‚Äôt work? It‚Äôs like Tesla‚Äôs lane detection feature. Why launch?? Pressure from the boss? Tell the boss to go back on vacation and don‚Äôt worry about it, while you actually build a functioning app lol

Original review:
The app is never accurate for orders placed, delivery status, etc. using UPS/FEDEX/etc tracking numbers in an internet browser actually works. I think this app wants you to buy things from multiple businesses using the app, similar to Klarna. There is no benefit, google search does a better job at finding products. Useless and inaccurate.
